turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Euphrasius of Illiturgis.
turn.1: What was the importance of Euphrasius of Illiturgis' visit to Rome?
turn.2: When Euphrasius was sent to Rome to free the Pope from Satan's temptations, it is said that he traveled to Rome in only half an hour due to the assistance of a captive goblin who helped the saint in return for some leftovers from the saint's supper.
turn.3: Was he successful in his mission?
turn.4: Euphrasius vanquished Satan, and was awarded with a kerchief.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Euphrasius is also associated with the cult of Our Lady of Cabeza ("la Virgen de la Cabeza").
turn.7: How is he associated with this cult?
turn.8: According to one legend, when Saint Euphrasius came to Spain, he brought with him an image of the Virgin Mary to which he showed devotion.
turn.9: What kind of image did he bring?
turn.10: According to the legend, this image was given to Euphrasius by Saint Peter, and is said to have been the portrait that Saint Luke painted of the Virgin Mary.
